description: Detailed intervention data for action-based clinical events. This table stores medications, vaccinations, procedures, surgeries, and therapies extracted from medical documents.
clinical_context: Use this schema for extracting interventions from medical documents - any action taken to treat, prevent, or manage a health condition. Interventions represent action activities (O3 'intervention' activity type) with details about substances, techniques, outcomes, and follow-up.

event_id.description: References parent patient_clinical_events record (the clinical event this intervention details)
event_id.guidance: This links the intervention details to the parent clinical event. The parent event should have activity_type='intervention'.

type_definitions.medication_admin: Any medication administration or prescription (oral, injectable, topical, etc.)
type_definitions.vaccination: Immunization administration (flu shot, COVID vaccine, childhood vaccinations, etc.)
type_definitions.minor_procedure: Minor medical procedures typically done in office/clinic setting
type_definitions.surgery: Surgical interventions requiring operating room or surgical suite
type_definitions.therapy: Therapeutic interventions (physical therapy, counseling, radiation therapy, etc.)

substance_name.description: Name of medication, drug, vaccine, or substance used
substance_name.guidance: Use for medication_admin and vaccination intervention types. Include generic or brand name as stated in document.
substance_name.contextual_use: Required for medication_admin and vaccination types

manufacturer.guidance: Particularly important for vaccinations for traceability. Include if stated in document.

lot_number.description: Lot or batch number for traceability
lot_number.guidance: Critical for vaccinations and medications for recall purposes. Extract if present in document.

dose_amount.guidance: Extract the numeric dose value. For medications and vaccinations.

dose_unit.guidance: Always provide with dose_amount. Use standard medical abbreviations.

route.guidance: For medication_admin and vaccination types. Use standard medical terminology.
route.contextual_use: Important for medication_admin and vaccination types

frequency.guidance: For medication_admin type. Extract as stated in document or standardize common patterns.

technique.description: Technique or method used for procedure/intervention
technique.guidance: For minor_procedure, surgery, and therapy types. Describe the specific technique used.
technique.contextual_use: Important for minor_procedure, surgery, and therapy types

equipment_used.guidance: For procedures and surgeries. Include specific equipment mentioned in document.
equipment_used.contextual_use: Relevant for minor_procedure and surgery types

immediate_outcome.description: Immediate outcome or result of the intervention
immediate_outcome.guidance: Extract if explicitly stated. Use descriptive terms from document or standardize to common patterns.

complications.description: Any complications that occurred during or after intervention
complications.guidance: Extract if mentioned. Use 'None' if document explicitly states no complications. Leave null if not mentioned.

followup_required.description: Whether follow-up care or visit is required
followup_required.guidance: Set to true if document mentions follow-up appointments, monitoring, or additional care needed.

examples: Return in 2 weeks to assess healing
Physical therapy starting week 2, follow-up appointment in 6 weeks
Monitor blood pressure and return in 1 month
followup_instructions.guidance: Extract detailed follow-up instructions if provided in document.

confidence_guidance.high: >= 0.900 - Clear extraction, especially critical for medications/vaccines

ai_confidence.safety_critical: For medication_admin and vaccination types, set requires_review=true if confidence < 0.900

requires_review.description: Flag if this intervention needs human review
requires_review.guidance: Set to true if: (1) ai_confidence < 0.700, (2) for medication_admin/vaccination with confidence < 0.900, (3) ambiguities or incomplete information exist.

extraction.followup_instructions: Return in 2 weeks to assess healing
Physical therapy starting week 2, follow-up appointment in 6 weeks

field_selection_by_type.medication_admin: Focus on: substance_name, dose_amount, dose_unit, route, frequency
field_selection_by_type.vaccination: Focus on: substance_name, manufacturer, lot_number, dose_amount, dose_unit, route
field_selection_by_type.minor_procedure: Focus on: technique, equipment_used, immediate_outcome, followup
field_selection_by_type.surgery: Focus on: technique, equipment_used, immediate_outcome, complications, followup
field_selection_by_type.therapy: Focus on: technique (therapy type), immediate_outcome, followup_instructions

extraction_guidelines.safety_critical_handling: Medications and vaccinations are safety-critical. Set requires_review=true if ai_confidence < 0.900. Double-check dose amounts and routes.
extraction_guidelines.follow_up_extraction: If document mentions return visits, monitoring, or additional care, set followup_required=true and extract specific instructions.
extraction_guidelines.complications_handling: Only populate complications field if explicitly mentioned. Use 'None' if document states no complications. Leave null if not mentioned.

validation_rules.medication_fields: If intervention_type is medication_admin or vaccination, substance_name should be provided
validation_rules.procedure_fields: If intervention_type is minor_procedure or surgery, technique should be provided
validation_rules.dose_consistency: If dose_amount is provided, dose_unit should typically be provided as well
validation_rules.ai_confidence: Must be between 0.000 and 1.000 with 3 decimal places
